settings.title: High Performance Skincare. Vetted by Science.
settings.heading: proven results
settings.copy: This is the highest calibre skincare. But trust should be earned, so every claim we make about The Good is substantiated by scientific data from a robust U.S. clinical trial and the first-of-its-kind antioxidant study.

settings.heading: Clinically Tested to Work on Dry, Normal, & Oily Skin.
settings.copy: We commissioned a third-party clinical trial to exclusively study The Good. The U.S.-based trial showed that The Good provides statistically significant improvements in the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, elasticity, dark spots, skin tone, and more.

settings.formula_headline: This kind of clinical trial is an industry rarity. We did it anyway.
settings.formula_content: Most skincare companies do not conduct such carefully designed clinical trials on their finished product. Those that do, typically test for 30 days, with roughly 10-15 participants. We chose to study skin changes in 53 participants over 60 days. We went well above the industry benchmark because we wanted rock solid confirmation that The Good delivers high performance results for all skin types, skin tones, and ethnicities. And that’s exactly what our clinical trial showed.

settings.copy-six: showed improved appearance of fine lines & wrinkles

settings.title: 9 out of 10 Men Experienced Healthier & Visibly Improved Skin

settings.heading: 3.4 Million Antioxidant Units Protecting Your Skin
settings.copy: We also carried out the first-of-its-kind antioxidant study, which showed that each drop of our serum generates almost 3.4 million antioxidant units. It also exhibits a rare property that protects from environmental stressors.

settings.results_title: No Models. No Photoshop.  Images from Clarity™ Image Analysis Machines.
settings.results_content:
The Good is proven to help reduce the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles, dark spots, and sagging skin.

→→ Drag line to see Before & After changes.

settings.copy: Instrumental assessments with Clarity™ Image Machine

settings.title: Look inside our clinical trial.
settings.main-copy: Of course we wanted to know what our clinical trial participants thought of the changes in their skin, but we didn’t stop there. The Good was validated with three separate modes of assessment:
settings.content-left: A leading U.S. clinical research firm conducted an 8-week study of The Good with a group of 53 healthy male volunteers, aged 37 to 64. Participants represented a diverse mix of ethnicities, skin tones, and facial hair types.
settings.image-left-copy: The average participant started with an ~4.5 rating of fine lines and wrinkles. After 8 weeks, that number dropped to ~3.9.
settings.content-right: All skin types were represented (dry, normal, and oily). Face and skin changes were evaluated ~24 hours after initial use, at four weeks and eight weeks of continued use.
settings.image-right-copy: The average participant started with a skin elasticity rating of ~0.35. After 8 weeks, that number increased to ~0.42.

settings.heading: -GQ
settings.copy: The Holy Grail Of Face Serums...
